title: How to Draw a Cartoon Horse

steps.headline: Start out your drawing by marking out a half moon shaped body.
steps.description: Draw lightly at first so you can erase later.

steps.headline: Steadily draw the neck and head.
Next comes the four long legs.
steps.description: Horses don't stand completely straight so the legs should angle out or in slightly (depending on preference).

steps.headline: To make your sketch look a little more horse like, first add the ears and then his long head and face.
steps.description: This can be drawn darker as it is the actual horse shape.

steps.headline: Mark out the details of his face and then his long neck.
steps.description: Draw these darker as they are the actual horse details.

steps.headline: Give him a lustrous, silky mane.
steps.description: You can color this in if you want to.

steps.headline: If done, draw strong thoroughbred legs, and block-like hooves at the bottom.
steps.description: The horse's hooves aren't completely lined up with the horses legs, they are slightly forward.

steps.headline: Put a saddle on him.
steps.description: But make sure that it's of right size. If you choose to make it more detailed, you can add a bridle too.

steps.headline: Give him a long flowing tail.
steps.description: You can color this in if you want to.

steps.headline: Draw in his surroundings.
steps.description: Maybe he's in the desert looking for his cowboy or maybe on a farm racing with his mate. You can color this in if you please. Before or after this step, you may also erase the guidelines you started out with.

text: Rough Outline Start out your drawing by marking out a half moon shaped body. Draw lightly at first so you can erase later. Steadily draw the neck and head. Also draw this lightly. Next comes the four long legs. Horses don't stand completely straight so the legs should angle out or in slightly (depending on preference). Details To make your sketch look a little more horse like, first add the ears and then his long head and face. This can be drawn darker as it is the actual horse shape. Mark out the details of his face and then his long neck. Draw these darker as they are the actual horse details. Give him a lustrous, silky mane. You can color this in if you want to. If done, draw strong thoroughbred legs, and block-like hooves at the bottom. The horse's hooves aren't completely lined up with the horses legs, they are slightly forward. Put a saddle on him. But make sure that it's of right size. If you choose to make it more detailed, you can add a bridle too. Give him a long flowing tail. You can color this in if you want to. Draw in his surroundings. Maybe he's in the desert looking for his cowboy or maybe on a farm racing with his mate. You can color this in if you please. Before or after this step, you may also erase the guidelines you started out with.
